These are blogs and web sites I highly recommend.

## Statistics and research methods

#### [Statistical Modeling, Causal Inference, and Social Science](https://statmodeling.stat.columbia.edu/)
The personal blog of statistics professor Andrew Gelman He writes about statistical methods and interpretations, and frequently publish posts commenting on examples from the literature. 

#### [Datamethods](https://discourse.datamethods.org/)
Datamethods is a statistical discussion forum maintained by statistics professor Frank Harrell.

#### [Credibly curious](www.njtierney.com)
I first met Nicholas Tierney at the RStudio::conf2018, where he presented his R-packages for handling missing data. He is one of the guys behind [R-miss-tastic](https://rmisstastic.netlify.com/), a resource website for missing data.

#### [The logic of science](www.thelogicofscience.com)
The logic of science is a blog focusing on critical thinking, scientific methods and logical fallacies.
